docs.snippet: The social network’s shares rose in after-hours trading, despite a net loss, as sales and earnings beat expectations....
docs.lead_paragraph: The social network’s shares rose in after-hours trading, despite a net loss, as sales and earnings beat expectations.
docs.abstract: Facebook's shares rise in after-hours trading, despite a net loss, as sales and earnings beat expectations; third-quarter loss is $59 million, compared with profit of $227 million in year-ago quarter; revenue rises 32 percent to $1.26 billion.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Revenue Edges Ahead of Expectations

docs.abstract: Six Pennsylvania teenagers are arrest on charges that they had beaten a neighbor on her stoop in Chester just for fun and then posted cellphone video of the attack on Facebook.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Six Teens Arrested in Beating Posted on Facebook

headline.main: Deal Will Allow One-Tap Purchases Through Facebook

docs.snippet: In a new test for the company’s stock, over 1.6 billion shares will be eligible to come on the market in several waves when a number of shareholders are allowed to sell....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a new test for the company’s stock, over 1.6 billion shares will be eligible to come on the market in several waves when a number of shareholders are allowed to sell.
docs.abstract: Facebook faces a new test for its stock, as over 1.6 billion shares will be eligible to come on the market in several waves when a number of shareholders are allowed to sell; shares have lost more than 40 percent of their value since the May offering; some investors are bullish and see long-term value, while others think an influx of shares will cause the value to drop.

headline.seo: Facebook’s Stock Has Suffered, but Some Investors See Long-Term Value
headline.main: A Steep Climb Back for Facebook’s Stock

byline.contributor: Evelyn M. Rusli contributed reporting from New York.

docs.snippet: The financial industry had hoped that Facebook would rekindle ordinary investors’ excitement in stocks. But the Facebook faltering just added to a growing retreat from the stock market....
docs.lead_paragraph: The financial industry had hoped that Facebook would rekindle ordinary investors’ excitement in stocks. But the Facebook faltering just added to a growing retreat from the stock market.
docs.abstract: Problems surrounding Facebook's initial public offering have stoked fears that the stock market may not be safe for everyone; financial industry had hoped company would rekindle ordinary investors' excitement in stocks; Gallup says 53 percent of Americans were in the market in April, lowest level since poll begin in 1998.

headline.main: After Facebook, More Fear of Stock Market
headline.print_headline: After Facebook, More Fear of Stock Market
